title: #IOPerformanceLoSCapabilities.IOPerformanceLoSCapabilities

enumDescriptions.ReadWrite: Uniform distribution of reads and writes.

enumLongDescriptions.ReadWrite: Use of this enumeration literal shall indicate a Uniform distribution of reads and writes.
enumLongDescriptions.SequentialRead: Use of this enumeration literal shall indicate a sequential read pattern of access.
enumLongDescriptions.SequentialWrite: Use of this enumeration literal shall indicate a sequential write pattern of access.
enumLongDescriptions.RandomReadNew: Use of this enumeration literal shall indicate an access pattern of random reads of uncached data.
enumLongDescriptions.RandomReadAgain: Use of this enumeration literal shall indicate an access pattern of random reads of cached data.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

IOOperationsPerSecondIsLimited.longDescription: Limit the IOPS. True implies that the system will not allow IOPS to exceed MaxIoOperationsPerSecondPerTerabyte * VolumeSize. Otherwise, the system does not inforce a limit.

SamplePeriodSeconds.description: Sampling period over which average values are calculated.
SamplePeriodSeconds.longDescription: The value shall be the sampling period over which average values are calculated.

MaxIOOperationsPerSecondPerTerabyte.description: The amount of IOPS a volume of a given committed size can support.
MaxIOOperationsPerSecondPerTerabyte.longDescription: The value shall be the amount of IOPS a volume of a given committed size in Terabytes can support. This IOPS density value is useful as a metric that is independent of capacity. Cost is a function of this value and the AverageIOOperationLatencyMicroseconds.

AverageIOOperationLatencyMicroseconds.longDescription: The value shall be the expected average IO latency in microseconds calculated over sample periods (see SamplePeriodSeconds).

IOWorkload.description: A description of the expected workload.
IOWorkload.longDescription: The value shall be a description of the expected workload. The workload provides the context in which the values of  MaxIOOperationsPerSecondPerTerabyte and AverageIOOperationLatencyMicroseconds are expected to be achieveable.

IOPerformanceLineOfService.description: Describe service option within the IO performance line of service.
IOPerformanceLineOfService.longDescription: This structure may be used to define a service option related to IO performance.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Name.longDescription: The value shall be a name of the workload. It should be constructed as OrgID:WorkloadID. Examples: ACME:DSS, ACME:DSS-REP, ACME:Exchange, ACME:OLTP, ACME:OLTP-REPA.  An organization may define a set of well known workloads.

Components.description: An array of IO workload component descriptions.
Components.longDescription: The value shall be an array of IO workload component descriptions.

IOWorkload.longDescription: This structure may be used to describe an IO Workload.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

IOAccessPattern.description: Expected access pattern for this component.
IOAccessPattern.longDescription: The enumeration literal shall be the expected access pattern.

AverageIOBytes.description: Average I/O Size for this component.
AverageIOBytes.longDescription: The value shall be the expected average I/O size.

PercentOfData.description: Percent of data for this workload component.
PercentOfData.longDescription: The value shall be the expected percent of the data referenced by the workload that is covered by this component.

PercentOfIOPS.description: Percent of total IOPS for this workload component.
PercentOfIOPS.longDescription: The value shall be the expected percent of the total IOPS for this workload that is covered by this component

DurationSeconds.description: Duration that this component is active.
DurationSeconds.longDescription: The value shall be the expected length of time (seconds) to apply this component to the workload. This attribute shall be specified if a schedule is specified and otherwise shall not be specified.

Schedule.description: Specifies when to apply this workload component.
Schedule.longDescription: The value shall specifies when this workload component is applied to the overall workload.

IOWorkloadComponent.description: Describe a component of a IO workload.
IOWorkloadComponent.longDescription: This structure may be used to describe a component of an IO workload.
